ke9jk-Jv8FdmkIXcZIjMnQ.text: Went on a Monday night around 7 and only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. Our waitress was nice but the service wasn't memorable. She kept saying she would "give us another minute" when we didn't need one. I get it though, she seemed busy. One thing is they seem to take your order on a cell phone....fine but doesn't seem necessary to me. At first I was annoyed because I thought she was texting while taking our order.   The chips and queso were amazing and reasonably priced for the HUGE portion. We took about half home and it was still tasty the next day. I had the burnt ends taco at our waitress's recommendation and it was delicious and a good size. I also had the mac and cheese which was very tasty but did not blow my mind like I thought it might from some of these reviews.   BF had the special of the day which was a chili with the burnt ends. Tasty but VERY spicy.....he's a wimp though when it comes to heat.   Cash only poilcy is midly annoying and the vibe is a little too hipster for my taste but overall a good meal. 2 beers, an appetizer and two meals with plenty of food came to $45 before tip.

WPfwGbxcFLw4Nv8gINpyiQ.text: Sad to say it is no longer BYOB. :( Now serving adult beverages.  Cash only.  As many have written, Smoke combines some really good smoked meats on fresh tortillas, with some great and different toppings. It can get crowded but we stopped by for lunch and were able to get seated immediately.   The staff was friendly and one person taking our order and another delivering the food.    You know they must smoke the meat when you walk in, it has the smoked flavor in the air. The rib taco with pickles, onions and a BBZ sauce taco and the pork taco with apricot habaneros sauce were very good.   The menu has expanded since my last visit at the Homestead location, but did not try any of the sides.

9kcgp3YgLV74OI-kRo6XRQ.text: I'll start by pointing out the positives of our visit. The margaritas packed a punch and were very tasty. We started with queso as an appetizer. The homemade tortilla chips are to die for and the dip was delicious. For entrees, we had the pork tacos, chicken apple tacos, slaw, and mac n cheese. 5 stars for the chicken tacos, slaw, and mac n cheese. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful.   Now the negatives... the hostess was super pissy with us. The service was slow and scattered. We enjoyed our waiter, so perhaps the kitchen was to blame for that. The pork in the pork tacos was flavorless and incredibly dry.

k_PavJ-d__sv5ibfc41HBQ.text: Smoke is the bomb. They get 5 stars for being awesome every time I've gone.   Back when they were in Homestead and BYOB to being in Hipsterville with a liquor license, they've stayed True to their original vibe.   Super awesome smoked meat with absolutely amazing sides. Cannot go wrong here. I promise.   PS The salads are amazing too (get one with brisket)!

XOML82OJCS1m8eKPCjYrNg.text: Love this place! Their Mac n cheese is amazing and so is the migas taco. They have a great ambiance and bar. My boyfriend loves their old fashioned. My only qualm is that it's always packed and hard to get a table. Wish it was bigger or they did call ahead.

mdiAId3jvRvgHIi870ocjg.text: The black bean dip with avocados is amazing. You can choose how many tacos you want for every kind!

jvK57hd2bcgQuz4LPizBLw.text: A 15221-MUST. Smoke BBQ marries authentic n fresh tortillas to modern creativity. Wear your white cause this wedding is the bees knees  Walked twice past the nondescript door beckoned.. but don't just open! Pause at the threshold. Empty those lungs. Anticipate. Then open that door and BREATHE!  Rich smoke fills your nose as you take in the decor: brick, wood, people.. tight space and full at 2pm on Saturday. Expect a wait. Don't expect a bar seat--there are only 12. Plenty of glassware and a hop-driven tap list. Only bar-complaint is the lack of foot rail.  The tacos were quoted 30 minutes and took 31; it's not Taco Bell..  1) Chicken apple - borders on chicken Waldorf, refreshing!. Boosted by salty bacon and light heat. Juicy chicken is slightly pink.. Excellent! Candidate for a top 5 taco!  2) Wagyu brisket - lightly dry but nice char, peppery spicing. Acid in good doses from the peppers and spiciest of the three. Very solid.  3) Pork - dull flour tortilla. Subtle spice in salsa, onions add tang, but overall bland. Pork is the highlight but too dry. The worst of the three, will skip next time.

zH7QDfZwCoOvVNwIhToLgg.text: Tough to give a 1-5 star rating of this place. Lots of pros and cons. I suppose it depends what you want in a restaurant... For me, more cons than pros.  Pros: burnt ends and brisket were excellent.   BBQ beans (for me) and mac were pretty good.  Cons: not cheap for what it was. Really loud. Won't be back with my family again because my mom and in-laws spent the entire time (literally) yelling at each other/leaning across the table to hear. Maybe that's on us for going at 6pm?   Not much seating.   My mom didn't enjoy the beans because they were much too spicy... And We don't remember them being labeled as such. Too bad, she ordered them as her entree.  What started me off on the wrong foot was our waitress. She seemed like she was phoning it in. In a place that loud, you really should learn to project with your voice. If older folks are asking you to repeat yourself, raise your voice when you reply, don't just simply restate at your original volume. I had to repeat the specials to my table. I'm 32, and they're mostly mid 60s. Then I asked what the house BBQ sauce was,  and she told me that it was a "traditional BBQ sauce." Does that mean vinegar base or tomato base? Memphis or Carolina? Spicy? Anything would help. I asked for a clarification and didn't get any help... So I figured that she either didn't know what was in it or hasn't had enough BBQ anywhere else to know the difference. I chose the coffee sauce. Across the able we had 3 different selections, none of which really thrilled anyone. The burnt ends were great, but were not enhanced by any of the  lightly flavored/thin sauces.  Brisket portions were small.  Odd experience. I guess if you're a real BBQ fan, stick to your hole in the wall/smoke truck restaurants. They'll be cheaper and more suiting to your tastes I would bet.  If you want a pricier, trendy restaurant experience, perhaps this is the place for you.   We left as soon as the bill came to get coffee where we could hear each other. I won't be back, there's better BBQ to be had at cheaper prices.

b8v6UykzGX-uG0OyNZX65Q.text: We went here in May for dinner before my bachelorette party. We called ahead for a reservation as we had about 10 people and knew the restaurant was small and busy. Even with the reservation, we waited about 20 minutes to be seated. Service continued to be slow. The restaurant was rather warm and could use better air flow.  Despite these apparently common issues at this spot, the food and drinks were delicious. I had a fairly decent margarita. Our party ordered several different tacos, sides, Mac n cheese and the chorizo stuffed avocado...no complaints about any of the food! The queso is some of the best I've had and served with fresh soft chips. The burnt ends and brisket tacos were our top pics along with the mac n cheese! $5+/taco was a bit much but considering the sides are enough for at least 2 people, you could still get a meal for $10- $15/person + drinks.

OS7GSjHMXfOzpsOKJmrDdQ.text: The rib dip was amaze. The drinks were on point.  I had a margarita and my hubby a whisky sour. I got the brisket taco and chicken taco. The brisket was good but a little dry. The chicken was so spicy I was sweating. Lol. My husband got the burnt ends. He wasn't impressed. He also said they were dry. The brocollini and corn was very good as was the jalapeno slaw. No complaints on the service.  Everyone was very friendly and super hipster. I like the atmosphere of lawranceville but will probably try a different restaurant next time we go to dinner that way. Maybe just go in for a drink next time we visit

dP40F-p1Wqah_lXVbV7vZg.text: I have been waiting to go here for months. The first time i tried to eat at Smoke, the wait was two hours so today was finally the day! Overall the food was good. The service was good. But for the food, this place is extremely overpriced.

qyEaxUbuM6gciGj3K-NKdw.text: If anyone gives this less than 5 stars, you're a dick bag. The burnt end tacos and something everyone must experience. Beer selection is good, food was amazing. Seriously, try it.

qgxYcRqINtpbQdl78iRqDw.text: "They tricked us with their cool vibes." - my wife  Yes they did. The reviews are great, the atmosphere was really cool, but the food was just way too salty. I ate less than half of what I ordered, drank an entire pitcher of water, and regretted going here afterwards.  We got the queso - looked great when it came out, but the chips were over the top deep fried oily and salty.  Next we split 2 tacos (Egg Taco and the Chicken Apple Taco). The egg taco was just too much. Maybe if I was really really hungry it would have filled me up, but tonight it was just overpowering my taste buds and stomach. The Chicken Apple Taco was better, and actually probably would have been good if I already didn't feel sick from everything else.  Oh yeah I forgot to mention we split a side of Mac.  Again, just way too salty.  Also they don't have any soda products. That's kinda a bummer for me since I really do enjoy a good soda with my tacos.   I can see how this place gets good reviews, I think maybe we just weren't in the mood for such a heavy and salty dinner.

H0nq1d5MxIHTB2I-IJySJg.text: My girlfriend and I heard great things about this place so maybe we just had bad luck on this night.. it was burger night and the burgers were not cooked to temp they were missing components that were on the menu. Their juice of the day and homemade soda was horrible. I believe they got too caught up in being trendy & "cool" that they forgot the food has to be good. The waitress whose name I can't remember was very pleasant and did her best to accommodate date us.. I would maybe go back on a night when I can actually get bbq from a bbq joint instead we had to order disappointing burgers

AOarj5973kRRjsRLyopB8Q.text: Great place! I did not deduct any stars for the 35 minute wait, because the place is making such great food, it's only natural that people are flocking here!  We came here with the kids, and were pleasantly surprised to see a decent kids' meal - a rarity these days. Yes, I had the usual Mac n' cheese and potato bite options, but it was several steps up from a chain restaurant kids' menu flavor wise. Our kids loved the broccolini and corn, as well as the Mac and cheese.  For us, we got the salad (no meat added on), which currently is a tasty mix of greens, house made potato bites (we ARE in Pittsburgh, after all!!!), cherry tomatoes, and a bleu cheese dressing. We decided to go for 4 total tacos, which is crazy, unless you are a college kid. One taco is enough to be an adult's main course - they are not skimpy. We chose the pulled pork, chicken, brisket, and chorizo. We had originally wanted the rib taco, but it was later in the afternoon, and they were out.  My favorite was the pulled pork, followed by the brisket, then the chicken, and finally the chorizo, although all four were ridiculously flavorful and the meat was well smoked. I do wish that they would turn down the spice just a little bit on the brisket and chicken tacos in order to let the meat do the talking, but the spice wasn't overwhelming.  All of the staff we interacted with were super friendly, and the food comes out quite fast for a full restaurant - sounds like they've worked on this from some of the earlier reviews. It's BYOB, and there's a beer shop next door and a wine store across the street. The iced tea and lemonade were superb, since we didn't feel like partaking in wine or beer at the time.  When we were done, we asked them to box up the leftovers (totally miscalculated - one taco per person is quite filling if you're eating a side dish or salad, and aren't a college kid...) and it was done quickly and efficiently. It's a cash only establishment, so estimate before you go and stop at one of the banks that are literally next door - or you can use the ATM in the back.  Overall, it's a great place with great food - well worth any wait you may have. I'm very pleased that it lived up to all of the hype I've read for the past two years! We will definitely be back!!!

Pmbf5dqBaPqX6TFnOPZVgw.text: Absolutely delicious tacos. Had the brisket and the supreme chicken. A little expensive but you absolutely get what you pay for.

1hy_ahsTiuri_NUPD0sqoA.text: Although Smoke used to be tacos only, they've recently expanded and started offering burgers on Tuesdays, brunch menu on Sunday, and on other days barbecue plates and pulled pork sandwiches. The side dishes here are some of my favorite things -- try the queso which comes with delicious homemade soft tortilla chips, or the brocollini and corn which is my hands-down favorite! I tried the pulled pork sandwich for the first time a couple of weeks ago, and it was delicious on a home made soft brioche bun. If you're in the mood for tacos, try the migas, chicken apple, or pork. They now have a full bar -- wine, beer, and cocktails.  Note that they are only open for lunch on Fridays currently.  I wish it was a little quieter inside sometimes as it makes it difficult to carry on a conversation, but love the place otherwise.

-AUsaGO89LipqICbH8a2Hg.text: Excellent food and atmosphere I am a vegetarian and they had a nice selection of tacos and sides that were meatless.  I had the veggie taco and the broccolini and corn which were both very tasty. Only complaint was that the music was ,though very fun, 90's rap, Tupac and NWA, was not particularly appropriate for young children.  Overall great and would recommend highly

Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3zWV_dvJKfEK-CruYb7guQ.text: Update:  They are no longer BYOB and prices have increased.  The tacos are still delicious and large (really enjoyed the migas with burnt ends and the brisket the other day).  However, after a recent visit (and spending 11 bucks on an average cocktail) my overall impression was much less enthusiastic as it had been in the past.  Reminder: It's cash only.

gimMA1dA0GeSmvtsEnYUiw.text: Yummy, but pretentious.  I've only been on weekends, but the wait is always super long.  We waited over 3 hours (on a Saturday night, to their credit) for 3 people, and then were seated at the bar..  Just discovered that Atlas (downstairs part of the Row house) is BYOF (what?!), and the awesome bartender there gave us the grand idea of ordering takeout and eating there..definitely the better experience!  Queso is my favorite from anywhere, but I like Doce Taquerita's tacos way better (and they're half the price, with like a 5 minute wait time).

OX9y0NOvqkGOhdSoYAoYNA.text: OK, so let me start with the good. Service was great - we were sat at a table promptly, waitress was attentive and not intrusive, kept drinks topped up without having to be called etc. The decorations and overall atmosphere of the place was great too, albeit the music was a little loud for dinner time. This part was really exceptional.  Now - the food. It was disappointing. We both ordered BBQ plates with which consisted of brisket, burnt ends, and pulled chicken, and sides of BBQ beans and Brocolini and Corn. At a place which has "Smoke BBQ" in the name I expected at least mediocre BBQ - but this place failed to deliver. Dry, lack of flavor, and lack of seasoning (mainly salt) all around.There was more smoke smell and flavor in the room than there was in the meats.   I may have to return to eat some of the tacos, though only due to the great service and ambience at the place.  There is so much potential in this place, if they could just improve the food!!

wq257asqcwsvs7jbX7BGjA.text: Best Tacos in Pittsburgh seems like wan praise.  Like...prettiest girl in the trailer park.  And I don't have a TON of experience with taco places (or trailer park girls), but I have some...and this is the best one.    I try to avoid referencing other places relative to a place I'm rating, but suffice it to say that Smoke has competition, but as far as a more or less conventional ingredient taco goes...Smoke is it! (like Coke is it...see what I did there?)  Nice beer selection.  Very cool decor.  Great location.  Friendly servers.  Great food.    Win.

4oMVFuJ-lR3oLdHFZd2yVA.text: Hostess is absolutely zero help. I live in NYC and they operate doors with 100% more respect, but have much more imporant restaurants. I'm sorry for Pittsburgh who's trying to make a name for themselves in the culinary scene, but this clearly not going to help. Love the city, but not the restaurant.

-PwnoG-Mx0RI2CzKkUdEUQ.text: .....Burger tuesday, had by far the BEST burger on this planet. Classic mayo, homemade ketchup, pickles, no burger joint this side of Pittsburgh has it close to Smoke. Worth every penny and then some. A must eat. Period.

NjK2oM2Gvdnhg0tBJKE0OA.text: Great food! Drinks are well put together and proportioned. Great Smokey smell hits you when you walk in. The atmosphere is nice and casual. The servers are very knowledgeable and nice too.

9zCci0m2O3bSYRcXlUjgLA.text: I can't get over whether this is a BBQ or a Taqueria. I get they're trying to combine the two but it's inconsistent and doesn't work overall. While the macaroni and cheese is delicious, the tacos I tried (pork and veggie) were dry and relatively flavorless. I don't understand why they are delivered to the table wrapped in aluminum foil, it's weird and downmarket. I also HATE (sorry) the strange, prison-style slop trays that you're expected to put your side dishes onto. The server seemed taken aback that we would want actual plates rather than a 9" x 12" tin shingle to eat from. Visited in early April and the space was freezing. Room for improvement indeed. Almost forgot: I've never had horchata with a strong bitter aftertaste?

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. What&#39;s with the prison-style slop tray as plate and the tacos wrapped as if for take out?

g-H9WjcttyoKxvYCjC3p7w.text: I'm always glad to have another dining option within a couple blocks of my house, so I was happy when Smoke made the move to Butler Street. It was good, but I think I may have been a liiiiittle let down after hearing all of the hype ever since it opened.  They did a great job with the space. It's very warm and cozy, with tons of wood and industrial finishes. It fits right in along Rowhouse/Atlas Bottle Works/etc.  My friend and I started with the queso, which had a great flavor with smoked poblanos and onions. It's served with fresh flour tortilla chips, of which my friend and I had quite different opinions. I enjoyed the salty, puffy chips, while she felt they were far too greasy and had trouble eating more than a few. I didn't mind this and actually took the remaining chips/queso home. The leftovers held up well on the second day.  I tried two tacos: the ribs and the chicken. The ribs came with pickles, onions, and barbecue sauce. I wasn't blown away by the meat--it was good, but didn't really stand out from similar tacos I have had in the past. $6.25 for a single, normal-sized taco feels a little steep if it doesn't completely blow you away. The chicken was topped with pickled onions, hot sauce, and an avocado cream. I liked the combination of the spicy sauce with the creamy avocado, but again, it was pretty average.  I hate to complain about this, but the cash-only thing... I understand it as a cost-saving measure, maybe in the case of a really tiny operation trying to reduce overhead, etc. But this is a full service restaurant in 2016, and while the items on the menu aren't terribly expensive individually, you will spend just as much here on a full meal as most any other comparable restaurant. It's not the end of the world by any means (and, if you forget to plan ahead, there is a PNC literally 100 feet away), but just an annoyance.

MctKIZZ7jOyYkHU9hVEpDg.text: Good taco but the Mac and cheese is very thick and caked in butter, was not impressed. Also the queso had the same consistency as soup, go to Moe's for better (and cheaper).

9g2xtP-5ihIkIRrUzN7jJA.text: I LOVE this place!! Smoke is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. They definitely have the best tacos in the Burgh! They just reopened in Lawrenceville & the new place is beautiful. So much more seating available. Everything I've eaten @ Smoke has been delicious. The Queso & chips & the Mac n cheese are definite appetizers. I always order the egg & veggie tacos both with avocado cream. Amazing! This past time I went I tried the Brisket taco & it was so good! Honestly I was a little leery to try the brisket b/c I had just been to Austin TX & tried brisket for the first time (which Texas is known for their smoked brisket). However I must say Smoke did a damn good job making their brisket. Not quite as good as Texas but its still really good!!  Service is always great, everybody is so friendly. The only downside is once you place your order it takes a long time to get your tacos. But it's totally worth the wait! Highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Broccolini &amp; corn appetizer..so freakin good!
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This may be the best mac n cheese I&#39;ve ever had!!

rEgXTPkpbZJsphI47a7uGg.text: The service was so great! Our waitress was so helpful. She curated to what I was looking for and gave amazing suggestions. Great vibe, service and food.

giyhnRGsvK_t6qbgC3V9ng.text: We came in for a friend's birthday and we were seated promptly ( we had reservations ). I've hear a lot about this place so I was eager to try it.   Our waiter was really nice and patient. We had a rather large party and two people were running late. Not once did our waiter loose patience with us. He was very up beat and nice even when asked to take a photo of a group of 8 girls while he was busy. He kindly took our pictures and had fun with it.   The ambience is very trendy, very fun. It was a type of rustic hipster, if you will. It's byob, but there is a 6 pack store right next door.  Unfortunately, to me, the food was just okay. I got the ribs taco, which was good, but nothing really special, just rib meat, onions, and cilantro in a soft taco shell. I also got the chicken apple taco. It was supposed to have apple, bacon, cheese,and a jalapeno mayo in it. I'm a huge fan of sweet and savory / sweet and spivey, but the spiciness overpowered the whole taco. (I can tolerate a pretty high level of spiciness but this was a little much) I could only taste chicken and mayo. The apple coleslaw was good, but again, not mind blowing, just a regular vinegar based coleslaw with apple in it. I did try my friend's chorizo macaroni and cheese; THAT, was fantastic. I would say best thing on the menu. The chorizo was well done, great flavor and paired with that Mac n cheese...absolutely phenomenal.   I read in a few reviews and was told the service was slow. I actually feel like for a small, locally ran restaurant they were fairly decent. Yes, it took a little longer than your average chain, but they have a very small kitchen, try to give you a higher end experience with their food, and have take out orders. Therefore, I think the service was fine and nothing out of the ordinary.   As far as pricing goes, it's a little on the higher end for what you get. I don't mind paying more for a great food experience; however, I definitely didn't think my chicken taco was worth what I paid for it (6.00).  The chorizo Mac n cheese was worth what we paid though. Although, I do understand given the neighborhood they are housed in.   It was my first visit there so I'm definitely not opposed to going again and trying something else. Perhaps, it may even sway my yelp rating for this restaurant. I really enjoy the vibe.  It seems like a good spot to hang out and get some small bites throughout the night.     Definitely worth a try.

Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribs

W3B8K7OFH3E_1vtGvVVdfQ.text: Excellent food, but slooowww, expensive and cash only

vsJYUryl1Pyazq30djrdeg.text: This place is such a great palace! It is not really a kid-friendly place but it's still a great place out to eat. I am not a salad person but the beef hash salad was delicious and I ate it all! Great Place!

5Z_piiIxwCiq5EbpRTUPkg.text: I have experienced a healthy majority of East End dining options, both high end and not.  However, my favorite dish in the city if the rib taco from Smoke.  The perfect mustard based sauce blends so well with the rib rub.  The pickles on it are also a great accompaniment.   I love Cure/Morcilla, Vandal, Smallman Galley etc, but in a vacuum, the Smoke Rib Taco is my choice (I always get 3, and then eat salad the next day).  There's usually a wait, but you can always do takeout.  Or you can do your best senior citizen impression and go early and secure a seat (the bar is fine too).  Difficult to accompany large parties, go with a loved one or random stranger you met on Tinder.  IF THIS RESTAURANT WERE A MUSICIAN/BAND:  Procol Harum.  I don't know a ton of their work, but "Whiter Shade of Pale" is still one of my favorite songs worthy of lofty status.

fIqgqCl1u4tO7W8OvOFCZQ.text: My bff brought me here when visiting the 'burgh recently, and I have to say...it was awesome.  We had the mac and cheese, brisket and migas tacos, paired with the $5 cocktail of the day. It was awesome! I loved everything about it.  The downside is that it's cash only, but that's all. Service is great and I'd come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

y2WAjAlQC9s8nUaa1pL2jg.text: Pittsburgh, where can I find legit tacos?!?! Ugh. Pros: available on No Wait. Get in line, if you want to go. Cons: so much fusion that I'm lost.  Hubs and I ordered the shroom queso and chips to share. I asked whether we should pay the $3 premium for the shroom version vs. regular. Hubs was intrigued by the smoked mushrooms, so we did that. When it arrived, he acknowledged my question was too True. There was hardly any mushrooms and the queso was liquid like. As for the chips, was that pita or tortilla? Oh, no.  I was wise and ordered only one taco--brunt ends. Hubs ordered the brisket and chorizo. Neither of us ate more than half of our tacos. Brunt ends was too salty. I was eating pita/tortilla as a palate cleanser...need I say more. The chorizo was okay, average at best. The brisket was fine, bit dry.  So, two beers, three tacos, and chips and queso was a $60 (which includes tip) dinner. Nah, no, I'm fine without. Service was at least attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burnt ends taco. Too salty...not worth $7.
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shroom queso chips. Hello, Saturday evening.

DLq15EJyvNEqUHMANPOqJQ.text: My friend and I came on a Monday. First off, we walked by the restaurant twice. If you haven't been there, the name of the restaurant doesn't really stand out on the door, so just look close. We got a good laugh.   We started with the original chips and queso. So good! I'm actually still craving those homemade flour tortilla chips right now! It comes with a bunch, so we had some to take home too. We also got their Monday drink special, which was $5 sex on the beach. Good deal!  We each got 2 tacos and it was more than enough. I only ate half of each and took the rest home. I was honestly a little disappointed in the tacos. Smoke has been on my list of places to go for a while. I got a pork taco and it was better than average, but kinda dried out. I also got their special taco of the day which was fried chicken and grilled chicken together with a bunch of other stuff. That one was better than the pork, but nothing amazing.  If I go back again, I'll for sure get the chips and queso again and maybe I'll try one of the beef tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The original chips and queso

eH1hoBWvM67DF8aZCsBDnQ.text: This was my first visit to Smoke since they opened a few years ago. I am so glad I went back.   First thing to know is they are cash only! An ATM is onsite if needed.   Second is you'll practically walk right by this place if you aren't careful. The door looks like but I promise, chances are they are open.   This is the tacos are large. I ordered the chorizo taco. Incredible. They have special tacos on the menu and the staff is so knowledgeable they'll be happy to make a recommendation. The tacos are also prepared rather quickly so it's no problem to try a flavor and the order and additional taco if needed. Be sure to try the Mac and cheese and other side dishes as they are also amazing.  To drink I had the Aperol Sprits. Very light and summery. Great choice with a taco.   If you love a good taco be sure not to miss this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ds4p5yvef2ExccxN4eqe4Q.text: I don't know how you could miss it as there is signage throughout the restaurant, but this place is CASH ONLY.   Dark natural wood is the primary adornment along with Edison style lightbulbs. I sat at the bar in the early afternoon and despite the later lunch hour, there were still quite a few people. I ordered two different tacos (house-made soft tortillas) and they came on a tray surrounded in aluminum foil.   The meat was juicy and full of flavor. You could tell you were eating BBQ, which I usually prefer unadorned, but the combinations brought everything together.  All that said, my two tacos ran about $7 each and they are not that big. Tasty stuff, but if you are looking for quantity over taste, go to Chipotle.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9TLkvj5EA-gGc10WWfVnlA.text: The food is fresh and good but is overpriced. The waits are always bizarrely long, which has been an issue with this place even back when it was in Homestead. I really wish they'd just fix that issue. Read the other reviews and you'll see, this is not a place to go if you're in any type of hurry. Doesn't matter if there's a crowd there or if you're the only people there, this place takes forever.   Also, it's cash only.

15NyloBB-xJ0hFUtoYw1FA.text: A lot of people love Smoke. I think it's pretty good, but always overpriced for what you get. It's always generally busy and you often times have to wait to get a table.   Queso is amazing, but also always costs at least $13 if not $15-18. Vegetarian tacos have been either really good or just "meh." I've never been as disappointed with a breakfast taco as I have been with Smoke. And again, it's not cheap. It's not like it's a $3 taco that was only okay.  Service is usually very efficient and the place appears to be very clean.  Overall, I don't really prefer Smoke over many restaurants, but it's not bad. I also have not had any entrees with actual meat in it so that could affect my perception as well.

49SmsICZWKjIlXPqmPXz4A.text: Food and drinks were insanely good.  Service was pretty lame. Server kept trying to push food on us. Like, back off and stop over-selling your 2-top, lady. Increase your level of attention, decrease your incessant need to get more food and drinks on our bill.

aalYZ8a4G5IGvrbpS30Iig.text: The food and waitstaff per our first visit was terrific.  However our second experience this past Sunday was ruined by the poor communication of the hostess.  My wife and I visited a second time with our parents along.  The hostess asked us how many and we replied 4.  The hostess then went to check on, and clean or clear tables.  The seating or wait discussion had barely started or finished.  And for the next while we thought she was clearing a table for us. We had been the only party standing in the lobby.  She returned 7 minutes later to tell us there would be a 30 minute wait.  We will think twice about returning.

vqNDpwYEAGbgGmCgQd2FsA.text: PRO TIP: Smoke is CASH ONLY, but they have an ATM.   I've been to Smoke once before - because heads up on Tuesdays - they only serve burgers and that's the day I always end up there.   However, we were able to go on a Thursday night a couple weeks ago. We got there around 6pm. The hostess said the wait time would be able 30 minutes - we put in our name and walked down to Wildcard to waste time. Our wait time only ended up being about 10 minutes, so we headed back to the restaurant.   We got seated at a small table - but it was spacious enough for the two of us. We ordered the Thursday drink special 'Negronis' for $5. To be honest - they were too strong and not good. I definitely won't order them again.   To start, we ordered the House Queso - it was delicious! We had to mix it up though - but the flavors were amazing together. Their chips are to die for!   For my entree, I ordered 2 tacos and we ordered the Mac n cheese to share. The Mac n cheese is amazing- it's very good. I ordered the chicken & apple taco - it was a great burst of flavors! It was so good. However, I hated the pulled pork taco I ordered- it had no flavor at all. I didn't even finish it.   Overall- Smoke has a great atmosphere and the food is very good!

Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iayJB6gZ2vuW2VQmmyHFvg.text: I debated how many stars to give and landed on 3.  Really think it is a 2.5. PROS The venue is inviting. I opted to dine at the bar. The tacos (one chicken, one pork) were very tasty.  My bartender/server was very friendly and helpful. CONS Cash only in 2018 is not very consumer friendly though they do have an ATM on the premises. Tip: if you bank with Citizens then cross the street to avoid this establishment's 2.50 ATM fee. It took me three tries to order a drink for which they carried all the ingredients. I began with a diet coke. No luck. They do not carry name soft drinks, much less diet. My server explained they make everything in house so they do have cola and ginger ale but it is made there and they opted not to make diet drinks as they were not that popular with their diners.  Fine. I tried to then order a mojito. Again, no luck as they do not have mint. OKAY... I settled for Maker's Mark and ginger ale, their version...result?? they should scrap the homemade nonsense for it ruint my Maker's Mark...  The tacos were tasty but way too big to try several. Note their shells were homemade, too.  Honestly, I would not have known the difference except being told. My honest opinion? Ok but Condados is just about a block away...with competition they better rethink the consumer experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos....

gPyYtlThHcxrtlrU7JZwbg.text: Tips: CASH ONLY  Happy hour: 4-6  parking: there is a pay lot across the street  I went here before an event at Bierport and it was during happy hour. My friend was already at the bar and I sat next to her. I waited at least 5 minutes or so before the bartender even acknowledged me. I ordered a beer that was on special for $2.50 and we ordered 2 mystery tacos and the mini queso and chips.   The mystery taco idea is really fun and cool! The chef just tosses together whatever ingredients he wants. One of ours was a smoked pulled chicken with bbq and crispy onion straws. The other was a ground beef I think with roasted corn. The homemade chips were good, only complaint was that a few weren't as cooked and crispy as the others.   I will definitely be back to try some more mystery tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mystery taco with a beef of some sort and corn
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mini queso and chips
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mystery taco: Pulled smoked chicken with bbq and crispy onion straws

UNglE1mLRy3GaxjrNmc4XQ.text: Friends from Lville asked us to meet them here after the PGH marathon. I was a bit nervous at first since it said they had flour tortillas, but when I asked they told me that they could do corn ones too. I'm sure glad that they did! These are quite the gourmet taco creations.   I had the veg and the BLT with chicken added! The BLT with chicken was my favorite of the two, but there's others that I'd love to go back and try. Unfortunately, the queso can't be made gluten free so beware of that if you are like me!  Everything I tasted had quite a kick to it. I love spice, but I know some in my party where surprised by the level of spice.  The decor is adorable, and it smells like a True smokehouse when you walk in there. The bar stools could be a bit more comfortable at some of the high tops, but it likely helps a with table turnover. I'd recommend, and will update once I try more tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

edvdf3HabZE6GCRuWpjEZQ.text: Everything is good. Literally everything. The burnt ends are my favorite but they don't always have those. You have to ask.   The Mac n cheese is so delicious.   Smoke is cash only so don't forget to bring your dollar bills.  Totally worth trekking to the atm.

c03rYJjva_I0bFmwQ9H4LQ.text: I've been meaning to try Smoke for the longest time and finally decided to give it a go last night. Being a Thursday night, there was a bit of a wait but they'll take your number down and text you when your table is ready. Giving you plenty of time to explore Lawrenceville or grab a drink at another bar while you wait. Unfortunately, there isn't a lot of space at their bar to wait for your table.   The restaurant is kind of tucked away next to the movie theater and doesn't have a big flashy sign to let you know you've made it. This gives it that "hidden gem" feel once you've discovered it.   When you step inside, the aroma of smoked meats immediately makes your mouth drool. The vibe inside is industrial and trendy. There aren't a lot of tables, which would explain the longer wait. If you aren't in any rush, it's worth the extra time.   The house margarita and old fashioned were both good drink choices. The margaritas are a good balance of tangy and sweet and the old fashioned was tasty as well. While the menu is relatively small, nearly all of the options looked appetizing. The tacos are relatively large portions, two, maybe three would be enough for a meal and the salads are HUGE. Both the tacos and salad were delicious.   The service was great. While they are busy, it didn't seem as though they were understaffed or anything and our food came out relatively quick.   If you ever find yourself wandering this side of town, hungry, definitely give Smoke a try. You won't regret it!

--qY7odS-W7A1lqaUUisbQ.text: Came here for dinner recently and had an excellent meal. We started off with the traditional queso and wow was it good. The portion is huge like it can easily feed 4 or more people. The cheese is the perfect consistency and the chips are delicious. I then had the brisket taco and the chicken apple taco. I really liked the brisket taco as it had a nice kick to it and the meat was super tender! The chicken apple taco was good too. Overall, the food was delicious and I would be happy to come back to try more tacos! A perfect place to satisfy a BBQ and taco craving.

A7LTrzv5sy8o4Q3eix_srA.text: I haven't been to Smoke in ages! I came when they first opened in Lawrenceville and just never made it back. But on Labor Day we were craving BBQ and with everything closed, this was a good pick for a little BBQ flavor. I'm so glad we stopped in, because it reignited my love for Smoke!  I got my two old favorites, the rib and brisket taco and they were just as delicious. I kept saying over and over after every bite, "This is so good!" I also got the apple jalapeno slaw, which still has that fiery kick to it, but the crispness of the apples balance out the slaw.   I loved their cocktail selection, but opted for a canned wine. I need to come back more often now and work my way down the cocktail and taco list!

F7kDEuCxV3no2El_KKNLlw.text: Not a big fan of this place. Only went because my cousin really wanted to try it. What drew us to this restaurant was that they had "wagyu beef" tacos. We ordered the brisket, and honestly it just tasted like ordinary brisket meat, nothing like wagyu. The tacos were pretty spicy in my opinion, it had lots of peppers, and not as flavorful as I expected. We also tried the queso and chips dip. I think it's flour tortillas deep fried. It was good, but the cheese was too watery. I wish it hard more of a cheesy texture to it. My cousin got the chicken taco and said it was good, but it was very spicy as well. My brother said the pork ribs were too salty, and picked off the crust to enjoy it. The brocollini and corn was very interesting. It was good and the corn was really sweet, just how I like it. I got a watermelon agua fresca and it did not taste like fresh watermelon juice with pulp. It was okay, probably just made from syrup or something.   Service was good, our waitress was nice and checked on us occasionally.   What mostly irritated me was that it took a while for the food to come. I understand that we were a larger party of 7, but we were fine with the food coming out as it was ready. They bring the food by seats I guess. A party that came a while after us and order way after us received their food before us. Not sure what the logic is, but okay.  Verdict: Spicy average tacos that are overly priced. Wouldn't recommend or come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Broccolini and corn.
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket wagyu taco.
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips and queso.

n-6MRySslK9E6JSnLtyuvw.text: I've gone to Smoke two times now and have a hard time getting over the sticker shock of the menu. The chips made in house are to die for, but everything else is just ok.   The queso is around $14 and while it is a large serving they do not give you enough chips to finish it with. I asked for extra and the waiter kindly brought my more, but then tacked on an additional $3.50 charge for the extra chips. By the end of it my "appetizer" queso was $17.50 which is more than I typically spend on an entree at any other restaurant.   I was trying to decide what kind of tacos I wanted for dinner when I noticed that many of them were priced around $8. I asked the waiter how many tacos came with it when he let me know that it was only one. One taco for $8??? That seems a tad extreme.   By the end of it we decided to stick with queso and one drink each and our bill was near $40. They now accept credit cards, but make you pay the 3.5% transaction fee. I mean come on.... 3.5% is not much, but you're already charging $14 for queso and $8 a taco. When businesses only accept cash or have you pay the credit card fees, that is a big turn off for me. It's 2019, get with it Smoke.

WxW36Ai1N8LykWU2BJDUOQ.text: They changed $5 drink specials to $7 because (as bartender said) "the owner wanted to make more money.   It's still great food. Chips and quest are amazing. However, if you are lactose intolerant, be warned. Lol

G1FRCpyQjr0zM-wQRbtV3A.text: So good news or bad news first. Let's start bad news.   First, the lack of signage. If I hadn't read reviews on yelp before meeting friends for dinner, we might not have found this place. My friends think they are trying to fit the hipster mentality and remain anonymous. I personally hate this. A sign with their name or even the address on the door would be really helpful. Second, they are cash only. Not a big deal since they have an ATM in the back of the restaurant near the restrooms. Third, it's BYOB and we had no idea. Didn't notice this bit of information in any comments or reviews we read online. Luckily atlas bottle works is next door and offers chilled bottles and growlers to go.   Now for the good news- the food! So good. We started with chips and queso. There was enough for four of us to share. I am a huge fan of homemade chips and these were spot on.   We also ordered biscuits and Mac and cheese as sides. I wasn't a huge fan of the biscuits; a little to greasy for me. Now the Mac and cheese, that was a different story. Yummy! My husband didn't love it because the cheese they used was a little to sharp for his taste.  The tacos were excellent. We asked the waiter how big they were and he recommended two per person. I would say this is too much food if you are ordering sides. My rib taco was overstuffed but delicious. The chicken and Apple was also excellent but the star of the show was the brisket.   We look forward to our next meal at smoke.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Homemade chips and queso
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac &amp; cheese
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rib taco

OEt87apWnmzwvA57C3soGg.text: I don't get the hype. Yes the tacos are good, and the queso is AWESOME, but nothing else is anything special. I will never understand why 1 taco costs $7 or why it takes 45 minutes to get that taco. I know it's all made to order but it doesn't seem like a sustainable model. Service is never more than a person taking your order then you never see them again. Bakersfield downtown is cheaper, faster, and awesome.

F54EtynSSW1TTAFevbShyw.text: First, the wait was close to two hours. Second, when the food came a member in our party did not receive their side, after they asked about it, it came once their food had already been eaten.  Third, brisket taco was dry.  Fourth, nothing was extra special. Fifth, there was no ice in our drinks and when I asked for ice I did not receive it.   Our waitress was nice and when we complained she did take money off the bill.  But still I would much rather walk in with no wait to Doce on the South Side, sit at the bar and get a 3$ awesome taco than this overpriced, nothing special food.  Over rated.

d2U7UnIHDrKQ4gQlNNXDUA.text: A couple of years ago this place would have been awarded a five star, but I'm afraid it's gone down hill.  They reduced their taco options and expanded into burgers and plated meals.    We decided to sit at the bar and bypass a 30+ minute wait.  I ordered the brisket taco and pork taco.  The meat in the tacos was dry and overwhelming with sauce, it poured out on the tray while eating them.  The mac and cheese side was bland and lacked salt.    Maybe we just hit this place on a bad night.  I will go back again to make sure, but this trip was disappointing.

t75CLZRNYlD2UN11bc3U7w.text: Other reviewers have mentioned that Smoke is inconspicuously situated on Butler Street and they are correct.  I'm not sure the name is even on the door- but it's worth finding!  The atmosphere here is Lawrencville trendy- you know what I mean - exposed brick walls, dim lighting, and contemporary art.  But it works and it sets the stage for a nice meal.    Fairly simple menu with several types of tacos.  I got the BLT taco with a nice and spicy jalapeno mayo that had a great kick.  I also ordered the Mac and it was very tasty and rich- I took half home and was equally full both sittings.    The service is good here.  I find it amusing that the restaurant has a large bar, but it's BYOB.  I'm assuming they have a lot of mixers.  I saw several lemonade and non-alcoholic options.  There's also a mini fridge you can put your beer in to keep cool.    I plan on being a repeat costumer.

slQksBdvE0Gy_va174_ZIg.text: Delicious food! Especially the brisket taco and omg their queso is addictive. Great ambiance too. Food in Pittsburgh is truly fantastic.

Qn8FBQh1S_oqafratyMBXg.text: I used to love Smoke so much when it was in Homestead. I feel like some of its charm and the quality of the food has gone downhill since its move to Lawrenceville. We've had several meals in the new location and I never leave thinking "God, that was SO good" like I used to.

2vb5EF9ubr-Ith9EbJOIgQ.text: Saw this place a few weeks ago and heard from a friend it was really good but they have long waits and run out of food. So taking that as a factor I went early Saturday.   I will start with the bad and with only one bad thing I will keep it short. It took a little time to get someone to greet me and put my small group in the system for seating. That was about it. After that we were seated fast and orders taken. Also I feel since it's a new place everyone is still trying to find the flow of it and they are all doing a great job but just need to get the rhythm down.  They don't serve alcohol but the beer store is right next to it and for a small fee of $1.75 a person you can do BYOB.  They have a small menu but everything has big flavor. I mean the brisket Mac n cheese was awesome! Every taco we got was amazing. The tacos are personal size but the sides easily feed 2 to 3 people with extra. We all just got the tacos we wanted and split the sides. The bill was not bad at all and everything was very good. I would go back and you should try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket Mac n cheese!

iGsUwsw1O8HbGjpbJM27YQ.text: Bangin,  May prohibition live on.    Open kitchen, clean food, good service.     Swag all around.

6--wuRtTPsVevlpb06sO8g.text: I've heard SUCH good things about Smoke, so it's been on my list for a while to visit. Needless to say I was less than impressed with the place.   Previously, Smoke was on the NoWait App which is awesome. It's a great app and makes the waiting far better than just going in and putting your name in. Well, Smoke doesn't offer NoWait anymore. So I drove down and put my name in, well little did I know that they DO still have call-ahead. So while there wasn't that many people in the restaurant it was still an hour minimum wait. When I asked if we can grab drinks at the bar, I was also told that they seat at the bar so that was out of the question as well. To say it was annoying is being polite. I put my name in, and went next door to grab drinks.   Over an hour later, I still did not get any text that the table was ready. So we went back to the hostess that said there was 5 more people ahead of me, AFTER AN HOUR. But that they could seat us at the bar... which while on a date, was the whole reason why we waited over an hour for a table.   Once we did get seated, at the bar, the bartender was great. After you get seated, service is pretty great. The ambiance is very industrial but very chic. I was impressed with both.   Now the food. I ordered the queso and chips and the apple chicken taco. The queso was delicious but the taco left a lot to be desired. To begin with, it was SO spicy. Like had to drink a few gulps of water after each bite spicy. While I do enjoy a good kick, I just couldn't finish the taco.   I feel like Smoke has a great potential to be a good restaurant, but first impressions do leave a lot to be desired at this place.

-beo-lKuj4EfDJJbQQsEEw.text: If the review were based solely on food I would give them 4 starts. I can't give them more than 3 stars based on overall experience.  My boyfriend and I had called around 4:30pm on a Sunday to make a reservation for 5:30pm. The host told us there was no wait and we shouldn't need a reservation for that time but he will put us down. We showed up at 5:10pm. The host said we may have to wait 15 minutes. Was a bit odd given that not long before he told us no wait and reservation wasn't necessary. 5:30 rolls around and didn't seem like it was any closer to us being seated. At 5:40 he tells us shouldn't be too much longer since people are getting ready to leave. He then updates us they are clearing the table... then we wait for 10 more minutes. When I asked him why he said they were waiting for forks to be cleaned. Its quite surprising that a restaurant can run out of forks during a time that is apparently not considered busy. Finally at 6pm we were seated.   We went back the following night (Monday) as a friend wanted to try the place. We called just after 6. They put our name on wait list and said would be about an hour, but may be a bit sooner. One hour later we showed up and figured we'd be seated asap. Nope. We waited 40 minutes more.  I understand they can't rush people out who are eating or socializing. But, they do need a different policy for reservations. If their estimated time has so much discrepancy from reality they should refrain from giving estimates or taking reservations as both prove pointless.  The food was good. Between the two nights we tried several tacos. All but the pork one were good. The mac and cheese is good.   The service was fine.  They do need to install a heater by the front door. The cold air comes in and regardless of how far back you are sitting it is quite cold.   Since the food is good, but the wait times are terrible, and service isn't anything spectacular take out may be the way to go.

FzPU5BseH8tmBSR6crDHjA.text: "Spiced" up my dinner. Every menu item I tried added a little spice to mix it up. A Pepper Lemonade (with vodka), a chicken Apple taco with jalapeno mayo, jalapeno Apple slaw, etc. Fresh food, great service and a very friendly staff made for an enjoyable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Apple and Migas Tacos, smoked cornbread, jalapeño Apple slaw, pepper lemonade.... And Louis

uIO34VTDjiyuzYTdJSvg4A.text: If I could give this place negative stars I would. I am going to hash this out while it is still fresh and steaming. Steaming like the pile of crap that is Smoke. My family decided to patron this dumpster fest. We were a party of 15 that came in around 5pm, we spent over $500 over the course of 2 hours. Let's begin. We walked in to smoke staggard, the hostess refused to seat us at our reserved table because she couldn't see the whole party. The hostess was rude and disenchanting. When we finnaly sat down, we had to wait an excruciating amount of time for any service. When we did, in short, it was crap. After we ordered, we also had to wait another distasteful amount of time for the food to come. For how short their menu is you would think that they could push some food out within a reasonable amount of time. The food, while not terrible was mediocre at best. Around the time we were finishing up the hostess walks by and gives us a dirty look for reasons still unknown. We make our complaints known to the owner who seems understanding. After which customers who are now waiting in the lobby begin harassing our whole party for the purpose of removing us from our table. There was absolutely no tact involved. Why would this be related to the Establishment? They cited the owner who was standing right behind them. They mentioned things like "we know the owner" "the owner wants you out" "you all should be ashamed of yourselves" intermingled with personal attacks at individual members of my family who up until this point had no interaction with the morons. All in all we get up to leave after 10 or so minutes when the owner doesn't say anything and they continue. This continues until the moment we all left. Needless to say, we will not come back. The food and service alone were horrifying. And the treatment we were allowed in the presence of the owner by the owners friends sealed the deal. May their Establishment be condemned according to their own actions. ~V

De6rr85Um8Gd0dkpNs6Iag.text: This is probably the worst experience i have had at a restaurant.. i ordered their famous chorizo mac and cheese and their pork tacos.. both of them came out cold. The waitress only took our order and never came back to ask if we wanted to drink anything..

6KzP5D7sXQwKVlTBvyUSxA.text: Overall this restaurant has a really good vibe inside and out.  The service was really good, and the food was even better.  The mac and cheese was some of the best I've had, chips were amazing, and the smoked meat in the tacos was delicious.  Everyone in my 6 person group enjoyed themselves.  Also the homemade soda was unique but very tasty.  Overall it's a great spot to eat at a really good price in a convenient location.  I will definitely be coming back.

ZaMsxgxLqENnBQQFVAWZpw.text: Where do I start?! Amazing. You first walk in and you smell the smokiness from the wood. I really liked the layout, a little small but the lighting and simplicity made the experience.   Food: I started off with a pineapple aqua Fresca spiked drink, which was very refreshing and quenched my thirst. My friend had the triple peppered Margarita which was also very good with a little kick at the end. We decided to split both the queso and the mac and cheese. The queso is a big serving probably good enough for 5 people. The chips were crispy homemade pita chips that came out warm. The queso was extremely good. Hard to stop myself from eating all of it. The mac and cheese was also delicious. Perfect amount of crunch, cheese, and smokiness. I also ordered the brisket taco. It was out of this world! The BBQ was extremely good. Very simple taco but made to perfection. If you come hungry I would recommend ordering two.   Overall amazing food! Keep in mind it's cash only!

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and cheese and queso with homemade chips. Amazing!

7sdY8F4rOIz1v7F7ITbh-w.text: We have always enjoyed the food and vibe at this taco spot. We used to go to their location in Homestead often but are happy they are now located in Lawrenceville. BYOB is a plus, but don't forget it's cash only. I would recommend any of the tacos, they are all great. Also, we ordered the queso and chips. Absolutely amazing. Soft fried pita chips are so good. Eat it!

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso

vMSQmXEkjYbmYo_TK9F3Yg.text: The chips and queso are good. The brisket taco is great, chicken taco was so so. Friendly service but the kitchen is incredibly slow. I didn't time it but we had to wait a long time for our food. Worth the wait? Maybe but I won't be back anytime soon.

blwvxV1SFZQ1mNyNG48GQg.text: By far the best BBQ in the entire area. Please stop bitching about the wait time. Sure you'll wait a long time because assholes like me are coming here from cleveland. The food is amazing. Well worth the wait.

MksAQ6e6f81c081Yzq2OBA.text: I'm currently at Smoke, and I'll tell you- the customer service is terrible. A 3 hour wait time for mediocre tacos? Fine. But the staff pushing me away from the bar while I'm waiting for change from the bartender while it's busy? Unacceptable. The bartender was great and the margaritas on point, but the front of the house needs some serious education on service and how to manage customers in an appropriate, respectful manner.

1IsgJc62aDp8vz4WHdq5NQ.text: I can see why Smoke may not be suited for everyone, but this local spot has quickly turned into a fan favorite for my wife and me. What we love about Smoke is their gluten free menu and happy hour drink specials. A great house margarita for $5? How can you beat that?  The most impressive part of Smoke is definitely the homemade gluten free tortillas. These monsters hold up to all of the amazing fillings featured on their gluten free menu (only minor alterations from the regular menu). Rather than wimpy single corn tortillas (always a disaster) or double tortillas (classic, but expected), Smoke has made gluten free tortillas that are soft, chewy, and hearty enough to handle all the fillings. Now the fillings are a feat in and of themselves. These aren't your traditional fillings--they've put their own spin on some classics and bring their own unique tacos to the table. My favorites are the Chicken Apple and Migas tacos, while my wife loves the BLT tacos (with and without added chicken). That's the other thing--two tacos are plenty to fill you up. As I said, these aren't wimpy tacos! Quality over quantity reigns supreme at Smoke, where you will get tacos stuffed full of flavorful and satisfying fillings.  As I said, this is a Happy Hour favorite for my wife and I, and we frequently run down on a Thursday or Friday to catch the tail end of the $5 margaritas. The bar staff is helpful and friendly, and you'll leave satisfied and feeling just the right level of buzzed off of tacos and tequila. We will definitely be returning soon!

9SRa1KdtqQMWJG4Vc9Xm-w.text: Writing this review makes me want to go back to Smoke BBQ all over again. Came here on a Sunday with a group of 4. There was a wait list but it took only about 10 minutes to get seated. For starters, we order the house queso. Their chips seem to be a spin off of pita chips baked in house, which are delicious and really upgrade the queso. Highly recommend getting one of their queso dips for starters. The house queso came with avocado and chicken and Fresno hot sauce, it was a bit on the spicy side so watch out before getting this one.   For main course we ordered the brisket and ribs. Highly recommend both of these dishes. The ribs come as one size and the platter cost $22. The brisket legs you choose from 1/4 up to 1lb. We opted for the 1/2lb. We also got Mac and cheese and potato salad. Everything was excellent and cooked to perfection. Portion sizes are very large so expect to be stuffed leaving this meal.   Let's not forget to mention their drinks. They have a variety of drinks including a great selection of margaritas.   Note, they do accept card but they charge a 3% fee so I'd recommend bringing cash to avoid any excess fee.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribs
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket with Mac and cheese and potatoe salad
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House Queso with Chips

x7Mm2KYAuoCpXUsSRUtpKQ.text: Not sure what all of the hype is about.   The food was ok leaning on good so, I get why people like that. The service the two times I have been here has been pretty bad. It seems like I was invited to someones house to watch them hang out with their friends and they will occasionally stop by and ask if you are okay.   I wasn't treated poorly but the staff was incredibly slow and would often hang out together at various points (mostly at the bar) to chit chat. As someone who has worked in the industry what I've experienced here seemed a bit excessive. Hopefully I was just there at a couple bad times.

qVyL_P1C35erhdtRb8EuGg.text: One of our favorite spots in Lawrenceville, and maybe the city for casual dining and great cocktails and beer. There's a good selection of local beers, including Roundabout, Hitchhiker and Eleventh Hour most recently. It's nicely curated - not all IPAs. We ordered house made tortilla chips with queso for our table of four (we can't do this for the two of us if we want to be able to eat dinner). Anyway, we all thought it was delicious. Another favorite is the broccolini and corn side dish - everyone we take there loves it. This time, I chose to order a second helping as my entree with smoked brisket added, and it was excellent. Others around the table ordered tacos and were very happy.   We arrived for a late lunch on a Saturday and sat right down. If you want to go in the evening, especially on a weekend, be prepared for a wait of an hour. Sometimes rather than wait on a busy night we find seats at the bar, and we like that just as much.

5zY5qOoQH9SK4Kct1BpKsQ.text: Great food, great beer, great spot. The tacos, chips and queso are definitely the move. We ordered the mushroom queso, it was incredible! Comes with a huge pile of homemade chips. The tacos are also solid portion sizes, you'll be full just ordering one or two.

Xvy4yGdW0hBu9hE8blIUqQ.text: Great atmosphere. Friendly fast staff. Busy Saturday evening..  grabbed a seat at the bar. Was quoted 1.5 hours wait otherwise. Great concept.. delicious food. Fell in love with the house horchata.. husband had the tangerine beer.. delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KAOoRRRELaHZU7zH3EzZaA.text: Mixed review! Keep in mind I went to a BBQ Taqueria as a vegetarian.  When you arrive at Smoke, the first thing you notice is clearly the smell of the BBQ - it's awesome. The entry way is lined with freshly cut wood, that they use to smoke all of their meats. The space itself is quaint (not very large)  On Cinco De Mayo we stopped in and I was surprised that there wasn't a longer wait. For two people, we were put on a wait list for about 35 minutes (not bad for a Sunday, especially Cinco De Mayo)  I loved that there were several vegetarian options. I tried the avocado taco, and the mushroom taco. Whatever the mushrooms were seasoned with made the taco taste amazing! The only thing that I was disappointed in, I wish that I had asked if they had a hard shell taco (those are my favorite)  There were several daily specials, we tried to order one but something had happened in the kitchen and they ran out. The brunch specials sounded amazing though (not vegetarian)   Drinks were just OK, different margaritas $10 very distinguished ingredients - grapefruit, "spicy", blood orange, etc. My second drink was wine (there were only three wine options on the menu) and came in a tiny glass (not even a wine glass)  My favorite part was probably the mushroom queso dip. I don't usually eat cheese so this was a treat for me - I have to say that the tortillas that were served with the queso made the whole dish!  All in all, I'm happy we stopped here. The atmosphere was nice and relaxing - and the food was fresh. I do agree with other reviews that prices are a bit steep. That was my deciding factor between 3, and 4 stars.   Side Note: Two homemade hot sauces on the table "Hot, and Hot AF" Clearly I went with the Hot AF - which was quite possibly my favorite part of the meal! Super hot, very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso Dip (Around $15) again, steep price
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mushroom taco (left) avocado taco (right) kind of tiny for $6+ each; no sides included

4w5PhathsYski6CUG_WxcQ.text: I have been to smoke over the years more times than I can count. I have always enjoyed my experience until this last time. I feel like they've either sold their business, or just gotten super lazy when it comes to customer care. They've added the ability to pay with a credit card now, but with a 3.5% fee. I'll just keep paying cash, if I go back now.   Matt and I entered around 5 for dinner. The hostess did not greet us, just took us to a table (that's now closer to the table next to you even more than before) for two. We could have been meeting someone else or have a larger party, why just assume? I digress.   With the rise in "popularity" of Lawrenceville, so have the prices at smoke increase drastically over the years. $14 for queso, really? That's silly.   The waiter was attentive enough, but I found myself never having water. I get it, it's free, don't complain, but this is the first time I've ever run into the issue of not having water here. Again, I digress.   I really hope this was either a fluke. I hope it's not regular practice there now that they kinda just don't care anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rib taco
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buttermilk Pie! HEAVENLY!!

xiYMDVRLhd9jSzApF3q1ag.text: Anyone who rates this under 5 stars is quite frankly, a swine. If I some how end up on death row, this will be my last meal. This places bbq recipe is more treasured than the crabby patty secret formula. If you're not from town, leave, if you don't, come here. On the 8th day, God made Smoke BBQ Taqueria. You catching on here?

bRUGGTcTIv2ur_Mt5tCKmg.text: Smoke is located right on Butler Street and is only marked by a painted S on a grey door. The restaurant is generally always crowded and it is cash only. There is a PNC ATM next door and a private ATM in the back if you forget cash.   The inside is very hip, modern and service is always efficient. There is a variety of craft beer and cocktails, but the best cocktail is the Loretta. The Loretta is made with gin but has a honey, lemon, lavender taste and is very delicious. There are dips and quesos offered as appetizers and they are delicious but very rich so I would recommend ordering one less taco than you would plan to if you're sharing the queso. The chips are house made as a giant cut-up flour tortilla and are amazing. The initial bite or two of the house queso may seem spicy, but once the hot sauce mixes in it's quite mild.   Tacos are generously sized but a bit expensive ($7+) as you order per taco. There is a variety of beef, pork, chicken and veggie tacos so there are plenty of options. The burnt ends are very smokey and delicious. I would recommend asking if there are any specials. Each time I've been to Smoke, there has been a type of fried chicken taco special and they have been my favorite. I love flour tortillas and all tacos are served in the house made tortillas.

odazDlIm2kWlojoI2_yNpw.text: I would say that Smoke has some good food it's the consistency that's lackluster! I have come here and had good service and ok tocos and then other times bad service and good food. The first time I came it was really and I have always had that day in my mind, even is it has never been that good since. I hope you read this and understand why I have changed my mind. It's 3 stars because everyone's has their good days and bad (and I have had done bad days here) but in the end when excuses are made and lack luster performance given it's just not with it. If you go and have a great time be happy and if the second or third time is bad just know at one time it was good and move on to the next place.

-y6vuoHThD3GdwqJ7a3JuA.text: This was my second time here. I remember enjoying it much more the first time.  The prices seem a little steep and it's hard to judge if they were justified because the food was good and had good flavor, but I still felt like the prices were too high.  Especially when I compare it to other places with a great drink, taco, Mac & cheese, etc.  The staff is super friendly which helps! I am glad I tried this place, but probably won't go back.

OhgEX4Jjh7rrHUHeOgdIvQ.text: One of my favorite places to go in Pittsburgh. They have incredible Texas style BBQ tacos and other meat selections.  They encourage cash rather than card payments. But if you know you want a great meal, do yourself a service get the cash and fill yourself on delicious food.

Y0wZ6Vtg8h7n8hjWi4v2sw.text: I love the decor of this place! It made waiting to be seated fun. Although the hostess was so busy that she didn't actually call us when a table became available. When we walked back in she was seating other people that came after us and told us our table's been ready. Love the mac and cheese and the broccolini and corn. Would come back just for these two side dishes. I got the brisket taco with added 'shrooms. It was a bit spicy for my taste and I didn't care for the flavor. I would skip the 'shrooms next time.

fUyMw8xl6qOYobmjI3G6lQ.text: I stopped in here to grab takeout (would have sat as stayed, but I was too sweaty/gross after working out). Only complaint would be that it took ~30-40mins for the order to be ready after I placed it on Yelp - that being said, it was worth the wait and did come out on time/as scheduled on the app. I walked in, picked up the order, and actually ended up eating both tacos on the way home because I couldn't wait!   If you're stopping in to grab takeout, or sitting down to eat, you can park on the street and pay, or there's a little lot down the street on the side opposite the taqueria (max 2 hours, limited spots). Place is also slightly hard to find (not great signage) - really had to search for it on google maps based on landmarks around it! Super cute interior decor/vibe, though, once you find it.  I got the brisket taco with avocado and cheese added, and a pork carnitas taco. Both were excellent, and not overpacked to the point where you bite in and it spills out everywhere. Would have taken a picture, but like I said - I was so hungry I devoured them on my way home! Slightly expensive for a quick bite to eat (~$10 per taco once you add cheese), but would be back for sure!

IM6xtpykTBewAvcnFZCROw.text: Spring is coming and we're in the mood for BBQ! We decided to explore Lawrenceville and walked into an aromatic delight for our noses, lol! We were greeted with a smile by our waitress and there was a nice crowd of all ages dining. We ordered brunch because dinner isn't available until 5. We ordered Chicken & Waffles and Biscuits smothered with gravy & eggs. The Chix & Waffles were delicous. The Biscuits and gravy were bland and the taste of flour in the gravy was unpleasant, but overall the service was good, the food was good and we will be back for dinner. We can't wait to taste the ribs and side dishes! Definitely a great place to visit when the weather gets warm.

photos.caption: Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smothered Biscuits...
Photo of Smoke BBQ Taqueria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles....

bt4bSCTN1ZYgn5VGqc_Zsg.text: My bf and I checked out this place after picking up some plants in Lawrenceville. I'd heard much about it so I suggested that we stop by when we were looking for a place to grab a quick drink and snack.  First of all, I love the decor. It's extremely unique and very Instagrammable. It was a pretty packed house and for a while it seemed the bartender was tending to the entire place and not just the bar. I had the Aperol Spritz and my bf had the Berry Melon Margarita. I loooooved the Spritz. It was a perfect ratio of the ingredients, in a nice sized glass, with not too much ice. My bf found the margarita to be fantastic.   Sadly they were out of the burnt end queso that we wanted to try but instead we got a small order of the pulled pork to share which was perfect size for what we were looking. Definitely an idea for a $4 app. Big intentions on coming back to dine!
